page.title: 17Gala Day,Kingsbury.
page.content: On the 26th June 1982,there was the first Gala Day of the re-formed Kingsbury Friendly Society.The pro- cession started at the Wyndham Arms, led by a horse called Candy Floss pulling a cart in which were the Gala princess and her attendant.There was a new banner,as the old one had been preserved in the church.The main dif- ferences in the schedule from the original Club Day were that the fair and the marquee were in a field by Stembridge school,and there was just one procession for women and men.Gala Day celebrations have been held each year since.The money raised has gone to charity.This year(1985)the money went to Kingsbury and Martock schools'P.T.A.s,South Petherton Hospital,the Cystic Fibrosis Fund,the Bradford Fire Appeal and Fiveways School for the handicapped.
